headline: Tater Tot Hot Dish II
description: Layers of seasoned ground beef, tater tots, creamy soups and French-fried onion rings build a great autumn casserole.
name: Tater Tot Hot Dish II
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of celery soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

In a large skillet cook ground beef with onion, salt and pepper; drain and spread into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Add tater tots; mix cream of mushroom and cream of celery soup together and pour mixture over dish. Top with onion rings, if using.
Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: My family loved it and easy to make.

Wow..this was so easy and delicious! I only had 1lb of ground beef so that's what I used. I added about a pound of frozen green beans and only had a handful of the french fried onions so that's all I used. My family inhaled this. Everyone loved it and can't wait for me to make it again.

I gave this 5 stars for it’s versatility alone. You can easily rename this to “empty your cupboards “ dish. Like many others, I didn’t have the exact soups called for, but as one reviewer said, “you can add cream of anything “. I also had a fear it would be dry so I used 3 cans of soup, mushroom, chicken, and broccoli cheese. But I really don’t think you can go wrong with anything you like.
Didn't use onions but did add 1 tsp garlic powder. Added a can of cheddar cheese soup along with cream of celery and cream of mushroom. Also mixed in shredded cheese and topped with cheese.
It was good. I think next time i will put in a can of green beans (drained) in with the soup and tots just to give it a little more flavor.
Very good dish! About half of another can of "cream of" soup is needed and don't forget to season the beef as its cooking. It can be kind of bland if not.
Added fresh sliced mushrooms and parmesan cheese with the tots and soup. Also used lower sodium soups.
I have made this for years and my family loves it. I always added vegetables on top and tator tots on the top!

This was really good! I always read a handful of reviews before I make any recipe so I did follow advice on putting the tater tots on the bottom. I mixed the cooked ground beef with the soup and added green beans and put on top and stirred it every 15 minutes. It turned out great! My husband really liked it and he’s not a big casserole fan. Will definitely make again.

This was a staple in our house when my kids were growing up. I still make it and now they make it for their families! We do it a little different. I use cream of chicken soup just because it's our preference. I mix the soup with the browned, seasoned ground beef and put that in the bottom of a baking dish. I put a can of French Cut green beans on top of that, a substantial layer of shredded cheddar cheese and then I line up the tater tots on top. The first time my DIL made it for my son he walked in, looked at it and said "What's that?" She announced it was tater tot casserole, she had just dumped the tater tots on top and it was unrecognizable to him. He informed her "Mom always lines them up..." She let him know he was spoiled! LOLOL!!! Gotta love tater tot casserole!!

Easy, comforting, and filling meal. Paired with some mixed veggies (peas, corns, green beans, & carrot mix). Reminds me of a beef potpie. After seeing the reviews about the dish burning at 350* for 1 hour I lowered the temp to 325* and it came out dark brown & crusty on the bottom, but not burnt.
Followed the directions as written

I’ve made this recipe a few times and everyone who has had it raved about it! I usually make it for my family/coworkers so I double the batch and use a 50oz can of cream of mushroom instead of four smaller cans of cream of mushroom and cream of celery and it turns out perfect. I also don’t defrost the tater tots and just mix them in frozen. I like that this recipe doesn’t call for mixed vegetables because most of the people I cook for are picky and don’t like the taste/texture of mushy cooked vegetables in hot dish, besides the onion, of course. The crunchy fried onions really top it off nicely. I place foil over the pan for the first 45 minutes in the oven and then remove it for the last 15 minutes so the fried onions get crispy and browned but not burnt. This will definitely be a staple in my recipe box!
My family loved this recipe, the only thing I did different was add garlic powder and a pinch of cumin to the hamburger and I added cheese with the french fries onions! Mmmmm so yummy!
I love this recipe made with green beans and topped with tater tats
Delicious
My family loved this, even my wife who is very picky. I did stir a little at 45 min and added shredded cheddar for the last 15 which was really good.

Delicious! I added can if cheddar and can of peas, mixed all together. Put tator tots on top with cheddar cheese and fried onions the last to minutes. Check after 30 minutes.
Loved it
Used ground turkey. Family loved it. Was fast and easy, just the way I like making dinner.
Fried onion rings were getting too brown so I added foil to cover and it came out great.
It was filling. Easy comfort/bar food almost. Not bad.

@ PAT FRANK; YOU GAVE IT ONE STAR BECAUSE IT WAS NOT A DIABETIC RECIPE. Anywhere in this recipe did it say it was suppose to be diabetic? You could 1 star just about every recipe on the internet. Geeez!

We loved it. We put a layer of shredded Colby cheese on top of the meat mixture and eliminated the salt ingredient.
My family loved it! The French fried onions gave it a lot of flavor.

This is a great recipe that you can customize to your taste. I read dozens of reviews and decided I would sub cream of chicken instead of cream of celery soup. Did use cream of mushroom. I added 1/2 C mild cheddar cheese to the soups, 1 T Worcestershire sauce, 1/2 can cut green beans, small can of corn. For prep, I left the tater tots frozen and place 1/2 the bag on the bottom of dish (sprayed with Pam), added the mixture of soups, meat, veggies, then topped with the rest of the tots. I sprinkled 1/2 C mild cheddar cheese on top. I left out the french fried onions only because I didn't have them. Next time I will use them but not the plain variety but the cheesy ones. My husband had seconds. A definite comfort food perfect for cooler weather. I also added minced garlic while cooking the meat and onions.

I made it with ground pork, and ground beef. I like the recipe and my whole family loved it. I also used half of cream of mushroom, and half of cream of roasted chicken in our casserole. I also put cheddar and mozzarella in this tater tot dish. I will try it again for church potlucks and Sunday football.
Didn't make any changes. Yes, I will make it again.
I added a can of mixed vegetables and some cheese under the fried onions. Loved it!

I used green beans, no onion rings, 2 lbs. hamburger. That’s all my changes
Loved it!
It was delicious thank you
Will make it again tasty
Everyone in my family loved this dish. We added some shredded cheddar cheese on top. Yum!

Preheated oven 400 and cooked tots on a baking sheet while working on meat gravy (~20min). Cooked 1 lb ground pork and part of an onion, added seasonings (½ tsp @: cayenne, garlic powder, paprika, pepper, thyme, Worcestershire; no salt), lowered heat and stirred in one can cr. of mushroom soup and one can milk, turned off after blending. Put several leftover tator tots (hard & dry from fridge) in the bottom of a deep pie plate, poured meat gravy over them, and smoothed mixture w back of spoon. Reduced oven to 350, placed baked tots over meat gravy. Dish was really full so put on top shelf w baking sheet on bottom in case it bubbled over. Baked 30 min, let sit out 10. Served with fresh cooked green beans. This was a little too spicy for us; also, I don't each much processed food so still on the salty side, can't imagine using another can of soup. I'll make it the same way again, but omit cayenne (spicy) and Worcestershire (because adds salt) or reduce all my seasonings to 1/4 tsp. Hubby gave dish thumbs up, approved technique.
We didn't like it. Way too salty.

Good recipe! So fast and easy to make. I used the cream of celery and cream of chicken soups. Skipped the onions on top. I agree the tater tots need to sit on top of the casserole to get crunchy. Adds good texture. Served with creamed peas to add a green vegetable. My husband, who doesn’t care much for tater tots thought it was very tasty and good.
i rellylike it
Sorry, I can't get into this. I was intrigued at first, but it's just junk.

i only made half the recipe.. except for the beef
hubby doesn't like cheese so i mixed 1 can of mushroom soup with 1/4 cup of sour cream and 1/4 cup water.. sprinkled about 1/2 tsp garlic salt .. salt and pepper on top of sauteed beef/ onion in 8 x 8 greased pan.
poured liquid over beef and onion mixture.. lay crunchy tater tots on top.. sprinkled FF onion bits over top.. baking uncovered 3/4 hour completed the task. 
rave reviews !!!
Instead of hamburger I used cooked chicken breast (or dark meat, even rotisserie chicken) cut into small pieces. SO delicious, kids love it!

Being from Wisconsin, this is a hotdish that my family has done for years except for the fried onions. I tried it that way and is just as good. The way we make ours is 2 lbs hamburger, 3 cans cream of mushroom, 4 cans of french style green beans drained, 3 cans of mushrooms drained, 1 bag of tater tots, and seasoning with salt/pepper. Sometimes we replace one can of beans with whole kernel corn, and sometimes add garlic powder. Fry the burger, in a casserole dish dump the soup/veggies/shrooms/salt/pepper and some a little bit of milk is added too. After the burger is cooked, drain and add to the mixture, stir and add the tots on top, the extra tots in the bag we push down into the mixture. Into the oven 350 for about 45 mins till the tots on top are browned and done how you like.....and then enjoy!....you can add onion too if you don't have picky eaters at home.
No change. I'll make many more times

Made this with the ingredients as listed, but made a slight change to then order since I love the tots crunchy. Make the meat and onion mixture and mix the cream soups into the meat. Pour this mixture in the pan and cover the whole top with tots. They brown and crisp really well and mixing the soup into the meat keeps it from burning or drying! Great flavor!
Great comfort food for fall and winter. I'll make again as it is easy, tasty and leftovers are great (if there are any!).
Very good, great leftover. Thanks
Absolutely delicious. Will make again. May add more cream of mushroom and top with cheese next time.

I added fresh, blanched green beans layered over the meat and soup mixture in a 9x13 pan. Added about a half cup of milk to the soup to make it mix in better. Slightly thawed the tots by putting them in the microwave for 1 minute. Put tots in a single layer on top and baked for 30 minutes. Sprinkled shredded cheddar and fried onions on top and baked another 15 minutes. Delish!
not bad, I added an extra can cream of chicken some sweet green peas. And one cup of Shredded cheese.

Used a 7 1/2 x 12 casserole dish. Had 20 oz. of hamburger and used 3/4 of the bag of tater tots. Still used 2 cans of soup - cream of mushroom and cheddar cheese - both Healthy Choice, and it was great. Added 1 can of green beans and about 1 cup of cooked frozen corn on top of the hamburger. Also put about 8 oz of cheddar cheese between the hamburger and the veggie layer. The changes I would make if still using the same size casserole dish would be go ahead and use the full 1 1/2 lbs of hamburger and maybe just a few more veggies. halfway through baking I topped with crushed Lay's potato chips. Served with Louisiana Hot Sauce!
It was great, we all loved it.

I loved this one. The french-fried onions were much better than the cheese that is usually on top of a tater tot casserole. I'm not sure about pre-browning the ground beef though. I kind of like it better smashed in the bottom and then baked with the casserole. Pre-browning is less greasy of course, but the casserole holds together much better if the ground beef forms a base.

I loved this one. The french-fried onions were much better than the cheese that is usually on top of a tater tot casserole. I'm not sure about pre-browning the ground beef though. I kind of like it better smashed in the bottom and then baked with the casserole. Pre-browning is less greasy of course, but the casserole holds together much better if the ground beef forms a base.
great

I added thin slices cheese on top of the meat and omitted the salt. I added garlic salt to taste while browning the meat. I used healthy request soups as well. Best tator tot casserole I've ever made or had. Great idea to add the onions on top!

Loved this recipe! Add a handful of shredded sharp cheddar to the soup mix. Also added Garlic & Cayenne Pepper to the meat & onion simmering. Mix meat mixture into soup before putting into casserole dish. Put tators on top, but I think next time I will add them into the mixture. The crunchy onions on top provided the "crunch" that is needed. So So good!!! TY very much.

Ok, for those having meat problems, mix the soup with the meat, THEN put it in the pan. The tots don't need to be wet, they're nice and crispy when used as a topper alone. Also, someone in my family is lactose intolerant, so we followed the recipe and skipped the cheese. Don't worry, it does not need cheese, it's great as-is!

This is an easy Tuesday meal that you can tailor to your tastebuds easily. Reminds me a little of shepherds pie. I mixed up ground beef and ground sausage. 1lb of each. Browned that with onion and garlic. Partially cooked frozen sweet corn and green beans in French onion soup. Mixed that up with the beef and 2 cans cream of mushroom (would have subbed one of the cans with cream of celery if I had it). Added a little bit of onion soup to mixture so it didn't dry out in the oven. Spread that in a 9x13 pan. Sprinkled with pepper. Covered in cheddar cheese. Topped that with Tator tots. Cooked at 425 20 min till the tots crisped up. Everybody loved and it wasn't too salty. :-) It's the next day and the pan is gone. I forgot the onion crisps but those will be used next time.

We are usually a steak and potato kind of family and don't really like casseroles. But we had some hamburger to cook up and when we cleaned out the pantry we must have had 20 cans of cream of mushroom soup so I looked up recipes and found this one. We were pleasantly surprised. We seasoned the beef with garlic salt, seasoning salt, cayenne pepper and black pepper. We used 2 cans of the mushroom soup instead of the celery and added a cup of colby cheese to the soup. We cooked for 30 minutes, sprinkled the french fried onions on top and then baked for another 15. I was worried that it wouldn't be hot enough as the tater tots were still pretty frozen when we put it in the oven. But it was nice and hot. It fed four of us with about 3/4 cup leftover. It was a hit for lunch!

We are usually a steak and potato kind of family and don't really like casseroles. But we had some hamburger to cook up and when we cleaned out the pantry we must have had 20 cans of cream of mushroom soup so I looked up recipes and found this one. We were pleasantly surprised. We seasoned the beef with garlic salt, seasoning salt, cayenne pepper and black pepper. We used 2 cans of the mushroom soup instead of the celery and added a cup of colby cheese to the soup. We cooked for 30 minutes, sprinkled the french fried onions on top and then baked for another 15. I was worried that it wouldn't be hot enough as the tater tots were still pretty frozen when we put it in the oven. But it was nice and hot. It fed four of us with about 3/4 cup leftover. It was a hit for lunch!

I love this recipe it is a good "go to" for an easy and comfy dish. I did add sautéed garlic, onions and green peppers to it and little season salt. Didn't thaw out the tator tots so it wouldn't get soggy, as per other reviewers, and worked out great! My three year old, nineteen year old and husband loved it!!
I use 1lb ground beef 1lb venison yummy! And we do spicy so added a few jalapenos to the meat and onion. And added corn to it also.

Good, comforting dish; I omitted the salt, and it was just fine. After browning the meat and onions, I added the soups, 1/2 of the still-frozen tots, and some frozen veggies and allowed them to simmer for a few minutes. I layered that in the dish with the other tots and onion rings. This simmering cut the baking time in half!
So yummy! I got a 5 star rating from my husband who loved it! Making for when friends come to dinner.
This was good but not amazing. I added garlic to the beef while browning. It was nice comfort food but didn't have a ton of flavor. I think it needed some additional seasoning (but not sure what...)

I have made this many times and there are never any leftovers. I dont cook the hamburger meat before putting it in the oven. I mix hamburger meat with cream of mushroom soup and onion gravy mix and spread it in a pan adding the tater tots and cooking for an hour. Then I add bacon and cheddar cheese.

I loved this, and really...it is so perfect, it's idiot proof! I use cream of chicken soup, and a layer of shredded marble jack between the beef and tot's. Also add a little sour cream to the mix and top with french fried onions before baking. Delicious. and the left-overs are even better once it all melds! Thank you!

This was very tasty and a snap to put together. I mixed the cream of celery soup in with the meat and spread the mushroom over the top of the tater tots and topped it with cheddar cheese slices then added the french-fried onions on top. I only used a lb of beef, how ever many tots it took to cover the top, and used the full cans of soup undiluted. It seemed to come out a bit salty for some reason even though I cut back the salt to less than 1/2 tsp. Easy recipe. Very filling. Man hearty. Thanks!

We love it! Here is the trick, put tots in frozen on bottom, make ground beef as instructed then add your soups and canned veggies and mix all that together, we do corn and green beans. Also I add some cheese too. After I mix that all together I put it on top of the tots, and stir it every 15 min to break up tots. They end up broken up into the casserole in the end. Finally we put the fried onions on the last 10 min of cooking. YUMMY! Best tot casserole ever!

I jazzed ours up a bit. Made a half batch and then added in some leftover grilled veggies I had. Also thinned out the cream of mushroom soup a bit with milk and added some garlic powder. Added cheese to the soup/meat mixture and then added a bit more for the last 20 minutes. I cooked mine at 400 degrees for 20 minutes covered and 20 minutes uncovered. Delicious!

Good! I took the suggestion in the recipe description and put green beans in between the meat and soup and skipped the french fried onions. I would use all cream of mushroom soup next time, as I didn't love the cream of celery in this. Browned the ground beef with minced garlic and added a little worcestershire. Thanks! :)
Last 15 min. added shredded cheddar cheese to top. Yummy!

This was awesome! I didn't use the onion rings and I used 2 cans of cream of mushroom soup instead of the celery. I also put a layer of monterey/cheddar between the hamburger and tater tots. The only thing I will do different next time is add another can of soup because I would like mine to be a little bit saucier. It is goooood!!!!! I will definetely cook this again!
good and easy

As a beginner cook nothing is more satisfying than seeing your family enjoy your food. And this simple yet tasty dish did the trick. The recipe is simple enough to make an simple enough to customize and that's what cooking is all about. I added peas but would've added more vegetable but i have a choosy eater as a brother. I recommend the french fried onions on top: they give great flavor to the dish.

excellent! Instead of cream of mushroom we used cheddar cheese soup and cream of chicken... we added green beans in to this and instead of the french fried onions on top they went under the tator tots to ensure them not burning! Will definetly make this again!
WAY to salty.
My husband loved this! It seemed like it needed something else to me, but was very good.

This dish is amazing. I used ground chicken (seasoned with s&p) as well as a can of cream of broccoli soup instead of the celery, and added a package of frozen broccoli as well as a package of sharp cheddar cheese. It's SO filling and GREAT leftover!!
This was much too salty. I might try it again and make my own sauce in place of the canned soup, but as is, it was difficult to eat.

This is a simple and great fall dish. Why not add some veggies for color and vitamins?? I cooked the meat with onions and garlic. To the recipe I added sweet corn, chopped broccoli and diced carrots. I also added Queso to the soup mixture. This turned out yummy and even my 20 month old liked it! I recommend it

This was good simple comfort food. I followed the recipe with the exception of adding a little roasted garlic while browning the hamburger and onions and sprinkling a handful of shredded cheese between the hamburger and potato layers. I only cooked this for about 40 minutes. The French fried onions were beginning to burn at the point. I would suggest not adding them until halfway through cooking time. Next time I think I would add more shredded cheese and maybe an extra can of soup, but that's just a personal preference. My husband and two year old enjoyed it and the leftovers were good as well.
This is THE BOMB!!! its a keeper I replaced the cream of mushroom with cream of cheddar cheese and it tasted soooo good my family loved it !! Economical for a family to make .
This recipe was very good but a little plain. I added peas, onions, and carrots. It tasted veeeerryy good!

Definitely close to a 5 star as written, but I added a few things to add to the flavor profile. 1lb lean ground beef browned with 2 teaspoons of minced garlic, white pepper, black pepper both to taste, 2tsp of Worchestershire sauce, and 1/2tsp of liquid smoke. Mixed soups, and meat together, add 1 cup of frozen broccoli cuts, 1 cup of frozen sweet corn to soups/meat. Cover bottom of 9x13 casserole dish, only had 1/2 a bag of tater tots so placed them on top, and then sprinkled the fried onion rings over the entire dish. Popped it in the oven at 350 for 30 minutes uncovered. Left the cheese out completely, and it was great. Thanks for a great base recipe, and a quick & easy dinner for us.

This was great. I followed some of the other reviewer suggestions. I added a can of cheddar cheese soup and about 3/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese. I also used ground turkey. I skipped the fried onion topping. Yum! My picky son loved it.
We love this dish! It's pretty easy for a casserole.

I used the base of this recipe for my hot dish, but I altered it a bit based on other reviews. I added a bag of steam veggies with corn, pea, beans and carrots and also 2 stalks of celery finely chopped. Also, instead of using cream of mushroom or celery I used 2 cans of cheddar cheese soup. I think next time I'd add another can of soup though because mine turned out a bit dry. Otherwise, it was delicious!
Made this on a snowy saturday night!! I found the kids and hubby picking at left overs an hour later!!

I was looking very forward to this after all the reviews, and ended up rather disappointed. Mine turned out very salty, and I didn't even add salt, just pepper. I did add an extra can of cheddar soup, as others recommended, and mixed the soups with the ground beef. But other than that, no extra ingredients or changes. Maybe it's because I'm a southern girl and not used to this type of food, but the whole family (including my 16 month-old) ate up the sides (peas and carrots) and left the main dish almost untouched.

This is an amazing staple recipe!! I did do as one reviewer suggested and used one can cream of mushroom, one can cream of mushroom and chicken and one can cheddar cheesse soup and about 1 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese also, but this was the best and every member of my family cleaned their plate. Thanks!

I thought it was good. I did make a couple changes. I added jack & chedder cheese I also added a little garlic powder to give it a little more flavor. It is a good thing I checked it early because the ground beef had already started burning with 20 min. left on the timer. May try again if I do I will defiantly only cook about 30 min, instead of an hour.

My family loved it! I added corn, garlic, paprika, chili powder and season all to the meat. Added milk and replaced Cream of celery with cream of cheddar, and it was really good. I think the seasoning helped give it some flavor, cause i can see it being bland without it. I also added shredded cheddar to the soup mix and the tator tots on top. My boyfriend doesn't like crispy onions, so for added crisp, having the tators on top made it a good medium. I also had it for lunch a couple of days later, and it was even better, just like good comfort food should be.
easy and fast and the whole family loved it! thanks for a great recipe!
This is delicious comfort food! It's easy and has great flavor. I use venison instead of beef and added garlic salt and powder. Otherwise I followed the recipe exactly as stated.
This was good and easy! I didn't change a thing in the recipe. I just let my dish bake a few minutes less because my oven usually cooks food faster. My sister and I enjoyed it.

I'm from Minnesota and this is a very Minnesota dish. I have come to find out that people from other places don't even know what this is. I'm finally going to make it. BUT I don't reccommend thawing the tator tots too much first because then they get really soggy and gross. I also reccomend putting the tator tots on top. Add corn, it makes it really good. I would also mix the beef and the other ingredients so that the beef doesn't burn so easily..
Was good, but I added a can of drained corn to the mix. The kids liked it too!! Thanks for the recipe!

I give this recipe a four star. The family like this but I did add a few things. I added Garlic Plus seasoning. I used Nacho Cheese instead of plain cheddar, substituted Cream of Mushroom soup because I couldn't find the frozen vegatables with cheese. I pre-cooked my broccoli & carrots. Tossed them into the chicken after I added the soup. Great base recipe. I will keep this to use again. Thanks for the recipe
Excellent and easy! I just used two cans of reduced fat cream of mushroom soup, and the entire pan was gone in two sittings.
Normally I don't care for Tater Tot Hot Dish. But the Cheddar cheese soup and the garlic powder made a bland dish into something I really liked and will make it again.
This was wonderful. Tossed it together and it was not how I expected it to be, but wonderful taste. My husband LOVED it! The onions on the top are a lovely added crunch!
